channel.title: Buying a domain
channel.description: I can and want to buy a domain. It's $7.50/year, and I don't think there's any HTML editor with it. I also have a choice to make the domain redirect you to a certain website (for example my no-ip). Should I get the non-html $7.50/year (don't know how well the editing will go + like 5GB of bandwidth total (I've had problems with bandwidth in the past where I'd reach over 20GB of bandwidth on webs.)) or do the redirecting thing to my ip on port 80 (Won't be 24/7 unless my computer is always on) (don't think there's any bandwidth limits there..)? Sorry for all of the parentheses..

item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

Well, thats decent enough i guess. i would just freehostia it, or use host gator. Freehostia domains are cheap, and they come with php scripts, free set up, they are really great. (only like 6.00$ a year to)

item.title: Buying a domain
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

Correct me if I’m wrong but I thought the domain was just an address. You also need a hosting company unless that is included, which I doubt for $7.50 a year. Its usually $20 for 2 years on a domain and $8 a month for hosting from what I’ve seen. I could be wrong though.

Read full topic
